snippet: The Audubon Nature Institute and San Diego Zoo Global plan to breed rare and endangered species on 1,000 acres south of New Orleans.
abstract: Audubon Nature Institute and San Diego Zoo Global are to announce plans to breed rare and endangered species on 1,000 acres south of New Orleans, bringing herds of antelope, okapi, Masai giraffe and other species to graze on the banks of the Mississippi River; breeding site will be among the largest in the United States.
lead_paragraph: The Audubon Nature Institute and San Diego Zoo Global plan to breed rare and endangered species on 1,000 acres south of New Orleans.

headline.seo: Near New Orleans, a New Effort to Breed Endangered Species
headline.main: On Louisiana Range, the Giraffe and Antelope Will Play
headline.print_headline: On Louisiana Range, the Giraffe and Antelope Will Play
